storyInfo: Manfred kills the Taran secret agent, and gravely wounds Mandragora. En route to retreating underground, Dagda departs from Siege for the time being.

attributes.content: Hfff... *pant*...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Your energy is spent, Mandragora.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...Monsters.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You Sarkaz... all of you, monsters.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: We're far from strangers to that sort of address.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: When I hear it from an opponent crawling on the ground, I'm inclined to take it as a compliment.
attributes.name: Manfred
Mandragora
attributes.content: *cough* *cough*...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *cough*.
Sarkaz, you're... just like those noble lot... disgusting.
attributes.name: Mandragora
Mandragora
attributes.content: That Arts...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: It's all natural-born—I could never learn it in a lifetime...
attributes.joined: That Arts...It's all natural-born—I could never learn it in a lifetime...

attributes.content: You have the nerve...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: To treat Oripathy as a blessing?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Countless Sarkaz are burdened by this curse from birth, of festering bodies, organs oozing—you see us only as pests spreading blight, drive us out from the cities.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: How many Sarkaz each day become crystals scattering to the wind, cannot even be laid to rest in the soil of their home, simply because they wanted to see another sunrise?
attributes.name: Manfred
Manfred
attributes.content: Yet you tell me...

attributes.name: Manfred
attributes.content: You envy this power? Is that your place to say, Victorian?
attributes.joined: Yet you tell me...You envy this power? Is that your place to say, Victorian?

attributes.content: You're calling me a Victorian. You really know the best way to insult me, devil.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Do you know... why I avoid Oripathy?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: The Sarkaz in the barrens... at least, before they die... they get to see the sun come up.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Us, we live in the cracks of the city, where a speck of black stone pokes out of your skin... and the very next day, you're food in the sewers for the metal crabs.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: In Victorian eyes, we weak little Tarans... don't even amount to what Sarkaz do.
attributes.name: Mandragora
Mandragora
attributes.content: Only power...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: Only power can let us survive!
attributes.joined: Only power...Only power can let us survive!

attributes.content: The Sarkaz have never been interested in the resentment between you.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: All I know is I've given you chances before. Multiple.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: If you clean up your act and return to holing up in the north by the end of the day, I'm even willing to let all your petty acts here be water under the bridge.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Haha...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Bloody magnanimous of you. Should I be kneeling in thanks here, o kind 'General?'
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You can dream on!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I've seen people like you... one too many times.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Let me guess, you like the idea... that we survive thanks to your charity?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I've had enough of it.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I've had enough of being a wager to you, a piece on the bloody board.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: My fate, and the Tarans' fates... are ours to decide, no other way about it.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Yours to decide?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You think you've managed to decide anything? From the moment you came to Londinium, your fates were sealed.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You... shut well up! I've... I've had my fair share of failure, but...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: So long as I kill you here, and take all the intel there is on Londinium, I can go back to The Leader head held high!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Kill me? With these grotesques of yours, barely able to lift themselves off the ground?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You know that even if the Gargoyles of the Royal Court stood here, they might not be victorious against me?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Don't you compare my Arts to your devil witchcraft—
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Ten grotesques at once?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: For not being an Infected Caster, you must have some natural gift.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Nevertheless, I don't even need to call upon the witchcraft you speak of to deal with these rugged little Arts animations.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Nngh... urgh!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I see your limits.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Have you noticed the split in your staff? Once your flashy little tool shatters, you'll find you suddenly have everything in common with the frail, ordinary Feline.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Ha... hahaha!
attributes.name: Mandragora
Mandragora
attributes.content: And what in the bloody hell...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: Does that have to do with anything?
attributes.joined: And what in the bloody hell...Does that have to do with anything?

attributes.content: The stone staff emits a crack in response.
The ground beneath them trembles, the ruined grotesques all around standing up once again.

They stagger and charge at each other, binding to each other tight, and form into a singular great statue, close to five meters tall. With a great roar and a flap of its wings, it swoops in, bearing down on the Sarkaz.
Defend!
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Yes, sir! General, you be on guard—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Take care of yourselves.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: This counterfeit cannot harm me yet.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: In testament to the Sarkaz's words, he uses no kind of Originium Arts.
The colossal grotesque turns to him with a howl, the wind from the beating of its wings blowing a torrent of bricks against him, its fangs almost touching his cheeks.
And yet he simply thrusts forward once.
The stone statue halts in midair, and seconds later, collapses into a sea of rubble.
There you are. No longer can you play about with those stones of yours.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Ha... devil...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Even now, you still act so... arrogant. All because of the damned... power... you were born with.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I'll kill you... I'll KILL YOU!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You think after killing me, you can scurry back to your Leader and reap your reward?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Even if you truly could pull it off... I invite you to wonder, would she welcome you back with open arms, or would she send you straight back to Londinium?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Relay to Count Mourning that The Leader assents to all handling of Dublinn forces within Londinium by the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: If necessary, apologize to that Sarkaz general—
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: —that Dublinn has no intent to ruin its peaceful relationship with the Regent of Kazdel.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: It was never on the cards to work in true cooperation with him, given the Gaul at his side, but we're still in no rush to make ourselves enemies, are we?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: As a token of goodwill, ask the Count to mediate, and have the other nobles' forces hand back the few Sarkaz Messengers they intercepted at the auxiliary plate close by.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Don't you worry. The Duke of Wellington will not forget the Count's efforts. The Leader and Dublinn, even less so.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Tell him he needn't panic. Once The Leader allays this current situation, we'll go meet up with him at Londinium.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: ...The Dublinn commander from before? You wonder how she's doing?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Mandragora... Mandragora.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I've been kind enough to her. I even went out of my way to plead The Leader for lenience. That's why Mandragora even went to Londinium. She barely scraped in that final chance.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You have to understand, The Leader's never been the least bit satisfied with what Mandragora and her cohort accomplished in County Hillock.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Why can't she just understand... that at this point, Dublinn no longer needs the title of the 'spectre force?'
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Ultimately, we look to found a new nation for the Draco and Tarans—
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: And how can we hope to gain the masses' support, with nothing but wrath, animosity and their terror by intimidation alone?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: If she could just comprehend The Leader's intent, learn to stay the flames in her own heart, withdraw safe and sound from Londinium... At least, when The Leader reads what a good job she did, there'd still be a place for her.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You know as well as I do, The Leader's... never forgotten her first Taran compatriots. After all, it was together they came out from the ashes.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I might be meeting a Messenger from the outside, come daytime.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: They'll surely be here on some count or baron's bidding, but without a doubt, behind them will be that duke from the Taran region.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: It may be they'll thank me, for I rid them of an unstable lunatic commander in their place, and established a better outset for them in their coming negotiations.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Sarkaz are always seen as useful tools. Yes, on that point, we and you are alike, loathing these arrogant nobles.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: However... you'll have to call it here, Mandragora.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: A dagger? You would sneak up on me with a dagger?
attributes.name: Manfred
Mandragora
attributes.content: Hahaha...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *cough* *cough*...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: And suppose...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: I can pull it off?
attributes.joined: Hahaha...*cough* *cough* *cough* *cough*...And suppose...I can pull it off?

attributes.content: Do your nerves grow through your heart? Did I skewer your brain too, in the process?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I've told you, you can't kill me.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Moreover, even if you did, it would have no meaning at all.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: No... meaning?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: If... everything... has to have meaning, well... there never was meaning in people like us living, was there?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I'll kill you. Not because anyone ordered me to...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Just because...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: It's what I want to do.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Truly... a lunatic.
attributes.name: Manfred
Mandragora
attributes.content: A lunatic... me? You look at that face of yours, always so confident and cool...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: Right, you'd be clueless...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: Because you always get what you want done, so, so easy.
attributes.joined: A lunatic... me? You look at that face of yours, always so confident and cool...Right, you'd be clueless...Because you always get what you want done, so, so easy.

attributes.content: Once the one you most care about... dies by your side...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Once the one you most trust... casts you away...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Pins you to the ground with your own sword, even...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Maybe then you'll understand.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Is this your final defiance on the brink of death? These curses of yours can't sway me one iota.
attributes.name: Manfred
Mandragora
attributes.content: Kheh... heh...

attributes.name: Mandragora
attributes.content: Then why don't you hurry up and kill me?
attributes.joined: Kheh... heh...Then why don't you hurry up and kill me?

attributes.content: You don't even need me to do anything.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You're already dead, Taran.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Taran... You're calling me a Taran.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Laid on the ground, she raggedly forces a breath.
The floor is cooling, chilling, and she gradually loses sense of her own arms and legs. Were they broken at some point? Or have they numbed in fleeing for her life?
Do you want to live, Taran?
Who is it... calling to her?
The sewers are right beside you. Climb down there, and those disgusting nobles won't ever catch you again.
Yes, climb down.
The sewers give off the intense stench of rust and grease. Parts ripped from abandoned machines and cold scraps from a noble's dining table mix together.
She's starving, yet she revolts at this hunger.
Rust, grease, but she can smell another scent.
She knows it. The odor of death.
The sewers are a tomb for the insects living in nomadic cities.
The wealthy construct cemeteries inside the cities where land comes at a premium, and the commoners, with little to their name, have no choice but to cast ashes out beyond the city orbits.
And the insects? They die without a word in the cracks between the plates. They die where the sun will never shine upon them.
Do you dare walk to your death? Should you have the courage to die, that is all you need to be granted a new life.
Leader...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: She just needs to crawl to her left, scant inches, and she'll clamber into the sewers... like back then.
And there on her right... just on her right.
Her Taran compatriot stares with eyes wide open, gazing silently upon her.
Sorry, Leader.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: This time...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: It's me... who doesn't need you.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: She uses the last of her strength to push her right hand out. Her touch alights on her old friend, changed beyond recognition.
No one's... after us now. Let's go home.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Even though your meeting's end will be in death?
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Someone stands before her. No firelight by his feet, pitch black reflected from his dagger.
Mandragora grins.
In her mind, she has met the true Death.
There's an entrance right below that abandoned factory. Push that crane out of the way and that'll do.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Alright, thank you for showing the way, Mr. Feist.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: We'll be going along here. Everyone not wounded, please lend a hand to who are—
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Bleeding hell. Doctor, we've got pursuers again!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: How are they doing it?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Ever since leaving the kohl factory, we always get found no matter how many waves of enemies we repel.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: We can discuss that in a moment.;Let's handle these ones first.

attributes.content: Right, this is our last chance to retreat underground.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We can't let the enemy follow us under at any cost. The Self-Salvation Corps has all their operations set up here, and the Sarkaz don't know which entrance is the correct one to these underground tunnels.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: On the off-chance a Sarkaz finds this one, the Self-Salvation Corps' and the Sudean borough's efforts will all be laid waste to, just like that.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: On it... uhh, what?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Doctor, you want me prepare to blow up this entranceway?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: That definitely works as a form of insurance.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Are the Self-Salvation Corps gonna like that...?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Clovisia gave command authority to the Doctor. What the Doctor says, goes.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Amiya, we'll intercept the Sarkaz in the estate behind. Wait on my signal. If we fail to head them off, I want you to set off the bombs before it's too late.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: They're over there!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Quit gawking around. Your opponent's right here.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Ugh––!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: One team of ten Sarkaz. We can hold them down.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: These few, but even once we do...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You... None of you are getting away.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: The Sanguinarch can smell it... he'll find you one by one... tear your bodies open, cut your throats apart...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Who's this Sanguinarch?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Could it be... the one who just raided another unit of Self-Salvation Corps soldiers?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Raided? You Victorian Felines wouldn't be worth his... raiding.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: He's simply... hunting prey. As the Prince of Blood's quarry, you wouldn't even register in his gaze.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: No need to listen to their nasty comments.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Indra, do you remember that run-in with the Self-Salvation soldiers?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Burned into my eyes. What a bloody scene.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I've seen plenty of people die, but just smeared all over the ground like that... barely even looked human anymore.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Dagda, what are you doing? There's still some of 'em over there, we can't waste—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Siege, I beseech you. Let us get out of here.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Do you hear yourself? You're the one who wanted to fight the Sarkaz, now you're the one getting cold feet about it...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I've suffered the humiliation of turning tail once before. I can cope with it again.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: So long as we can escort Siege safely out of this area, I'm willing to come back and wage war to the bloody end with these Sarkaz at any time.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Siege, have you finally made your decision?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Perhaps I have.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Dagda, I've already seen your choice.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: My... choice?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Go.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hold on...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Go and find the one you need.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Don't let these Sarkaz stand in your way.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Are all of us down now?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: All surviving Self-Salvation soldiers are here.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: It's all thanks to you that we could even make it here.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.options: What about Vina?;We're still missing four.

attributes.content: We're here.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Three returning for the Siege Group.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Um, what about Miss Dagda?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Is... Is she alright?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Don't mention that bloody arsehole to me!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: She's not going to feel it no matter how hard you pound the walls, love.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Er...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Dagda has her own things she needs to do. Amiya, I apologize to you and the Doctor for her departure.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No, no need to apologize. I sympathize, these are special circumstances. I can understand Miss Dagda's decision.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: If we're sure we don't have to wait for her—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Y—You got it!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: That's that blown, then, eh...?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: If Dagda wants to come back, maybe she'll... have issues finding the way...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: She won't.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina, what's 'she won't?' She won't find her way to us, or she won't come back?!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Leave Vina alone. We've still got a ways forward to go.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Right. Forward we go. The Self-Salvation's soldiers are still waiting for us.
attributes.name: Siege
